definition: abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Our country has a long history, culture, source of long, countless art since ancient times.
sentences.chinese: 我國曆史悠久，文化源長，自古至今書畫家不計其數。

sentences.english: In the history of Chinese art, Huang Shen, a highly successful calligraphers and painters.
sentences.chinese: 在中國美術史上，黃慎是一位卓有成就的書畫家。

sentences.english: There are the authorizations by the artists' autography for all the phone cards which are authentic.
sentences.chinese: 均有書畫家先生親筆授權書，枚枚爲真。

sentences.english: It turned into sign of calligraphers and painters after the Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 唐代以後文人畫的興盛又使之爲書畫家個人字號所用。

definition: surname Wu/area comprising southern Jiangsu, northern Zhejiang and Shanghai/name of states in Southern China at different historical periods
